abstract.p: Letter by Alex MacLeod responds to June 15 article on best photo printer; says article missed an opportunity when it failed to include in test what he believes is best printer: Alps MD-5000

block.p: I think that Peter H. Lewis missed an opportunity to test what is in my opinion the best photo printer, the Alps MD-5000.

It prints exceptional photos on just about any media because the ink goes on dry (and smudgeproof). Most of the cost of printing photos on ink-jet printers involves the special paper that is needed. The Alps, even my lowly MD-4000, delivers excellent results on 32-pound, matte-coated paper (about $6 per 100 sheets), and it will print on any paper up to 110 pounds.

Although the cassette-type cartridges cost a bit more and don't last as long, the savings in media costs more than offset it. I would heartily recommend it for anyone looking to print photos on their computer. It even works with Macintoshes.
